info.title: Integrators Production API
info.description: Endpoint for public API & 3rd party integrations

queue_uid.description: The UUID used to check the status of the POAP minting.

address.description: The collector's Ethereum address or ENS.

id.description: The numeric ID of the delivery.

post.description: This endpoint is used to claim a POAP from a delivery.
post.x-amazon-apigateway-request-validator: Validate query string parameters and headers

id.description: The numeric ID of the claim.

qr_hash.description: A six-digit alphanumeric code used to claim a POAP. For example, in the mint-link https://app.poap.xyz/claim/2abwt1, the `qr_hash` is the code located at the end URL: 2abwt1.

transaction_request_id.description: The Transaction Request ID that can be used to identify the status of the transaction request using GET /transaction-requests/id.

event_id.description: The numeric ID of the event.

beneficiary.description: The Etherem address or email the collector claimed with. If ENS was used to claim then this will show the resolved Ethereum address.

user_input.description: The Ethereum address, ENS, or email the collector claimed with.

signer.description: The POAP-owned address that sent the transaction to mint the POAP.

claimed.description: Whether the claim code has been used or not.

claimed_date.description: The datetime when the POAP was claimed.

created_date.description: The datetime when the claim codes were created.

is_active.description: Whether the claim is active or not.

id.description: The numeric ID of the event.

fancy_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the event. This is generated based on the event name at event creation and cannot be edited.

description.description: The description of the event. Max length is 1500 characters.
description.example: This is an example event description

city.description: The city where event takes place. This field is optional for virtual events.

country.description: The country where the event takes place. This field is optional for virtual events.

event_url.description: The URL of a website the attendees should visit.

image_url.description:
This provides the URL of the POAP image.
To request a smaller, lower resolution version of the image, simply append "?size=small" to the end of the URL. For example, "https://poap.xyz/image.png?size=small".

animation_url.description: The URL of the POAP animation.

year.description: The year the event took place.

start_date.description: The start date of the event. Must be in YYYY-MM-DD or MM-DD-YYYY format.

end_date.description: The end date of the event. Must be in YYYY-MM-DD or MM-DD-YYYY format.

expiry_date.description: The limit date for POAPs to be claimable for the event. Must be in YYYY-MM-DD or MM-DD-YYYY format.

from_admin.description: Whether the event was created by a POAP admin.

event_template_id.description: The ID of the event template for POAP’s claim page (https://app.poap.xyz/claim/xxxxxx).

private_event.description: If true, the event is private and will be filtered out in POAP’s frontend. Test events should be made private.

address.description: The collector’s Ethereum address, ENS, or email.

qr_hash.description: A six-digit alphanumeric code used to claim a POAP. For example, in the mint-link https://app.poap.xyz/claim/2abwt1, the `qr_hash` is the code located at the end URL: 2abwt1.

secret.description: An authentication code that’s unique to each individual mint-link. This code can be retrieved with the GET /actions/claim-qr endpoint.

post.description: This endpoint is used to claim a POAP given a previously created mint-link. The claim status of the mint-link can be retrieved with the GET /actions/claim-qr endpoint.

parameters.description: A six-digit alphanumeric code used to claim a POAP. For example, in the mint-link https://app.poap.xyz/claim/2abwt1, the `qr_hash` is the code located at the end URL: 2abwt1.

get.description: This endpoint can be used to look up information on an individual mint-link including the claim status, `secret` code, collector (if claimed), and event information.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The collector's Ethereum address or ENS.

parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: The numeric ID of the event.

get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of POAPs held by an address and the event details, token ID, chain, and owner address for each.
          A 200 status code with an empty list is returned when the address does not hold any POAPs.
          If you already know the event ID, you can use GET /actions/scan/{address}/{eventID} to check if an address holds that POAP.
          Note: For large collections of POAPs, it may take a while to load the artwork, since average size of the original artwork can be ~2MB per item (we allow upto 4MB). For solving this, we've developed a way to offer compressed artwork. To use this, you can request a smaller, lower resolution version of the image, simply append "?size=small" to the end of the image_url field value. For example, "https://poap.xyz/image.png?size=small".
          For more options with artwork sizes, you can also use extra small, small, medium, large, and extra large file sizes, in addition to the original size.
          xsmall = 64x64px
          small = 128x128px
          medium = 256x256px
          large = 512x512px
          xlarge = 1024x1024px

supply.description: The total amount of POAPs minted.

drop_image.description: Users may request one of two types of images available. `dropImage` can be specified by `type` as `ORIGINAL` or `CROP` to receive desired image type.

public_id.description: The ID of the drop image

image_id.description: The ID of the drop image

filename.description: The filename of the drop image

mime_type.description: The mime type of the drop image

url.description: The URL of the drop image

type.description: The type of the drop image

tokenId.description: The unique POAP token ID. An empty string will be returned for POAPs assigned to an email.

chain.description: The chain the POAP is currently on: mainnet or xdai.

created.description: The time the POAP was minted in GnosisChain.

migrated.description: The time the POAP was migrated to Ethereum Mainnet.

get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of POAPs held by an address and the event details, token ID, chain, and owner address for each.
          A 200 status code with an empty list is returned when the address does not hold any POAPs.
          If you already know the event ID, you can use GET /actions/scan/{address}/{eventID} to check if an address holds that POAP.
          Note: For large collections of POAPs, it may take a while to load the artwork, since average size of the original artwork can be ~2MB per item (we allow upto 4MB). For solving this, we've developed a way to offer compressed artwork. To use this, you can request a smaller, lower resolution version of the image, simply append "?size=small" to the end of the image_url field value. For example, "https://poap.xyz/image.png?size=small".
          For more options with artwork sizes, you can also use extra small, small, medium, large, and extra large file sizes, in addition to the original size.
          xsmall = 64x64px
          small = 128x128px
          medium = 256x256px
          large = 512x512px
          xlarge = 1024x1024px

id.description: The numeric ID of the delivery.

slug.description: The unique identifying part of the delivery link: https://poap.delivery/{slug}

card_title.description: The delivery title used in the card-level view on https://poap.delivery/.

card_text.description: The delivery description used in the card-level view on https://poap.delivery/.

metadata_title.description: The delivery metadata title used in social card previews when sharing the delivery link.

metadata_description.description: The delivery metadata description used in social card previews when sharing the delivery link.

page_title.description: The delivery title used in the page-level view on https://poap.delivery/{slug}.

page_title_image.description: An image URL for the delivery image used alongside the title in the page-level view (https://poap.delivery/{slug}).

page_text.description: The delivery description used in the page-level view on https://poap.delivery/{slug}.

event_ids.description: The numeric ID of the drop to be delivered.

image.description: An image URL for the delivery image used in the card-level view on the deliveries homepage (https://poap.delivery/) as well as the page-level view (https://poap.delivery/{slug}).

active.description: Whether a delivery is currently active or not. If false, the delivery will not be claimable via website or API.

claimed_addresses.description: The number of addresses that claimed the delivery.

total_addresses.description: The total number of addresses for delivery.

private.description: Whether a delivery is private or not. If false, the delivery will not be shown on the delivery homepage (https://poap.delivery/), but it will still be visible on the individual delivery page (https://poap.delivery/{slug}) if the slug is known.

slug.description: The unique identifying part of the delivery link: https://poap.delivery/{slug}

post.description:
This endpoint is used to create a new event. Please see the [quality guidelines](https://documentation.poap.tech/docs/integration-quality-requirements) for responsible event creation and distribution as well as why it's important.

After submitting, an email will be sent to the provided email address confirming the creation of the event. A follow up email will be sent when the event has been approved or declined. If approved, the email will contain the requested mint-link codes for the event.

**Note**: For testing, please indicate that it's a test by adding 'test' on the artwork and title, mark the event as private, and request no more than 10 mint links.

put.description:
This endpoint is used to modify an event’s details. Attributes that can be changed are the event name, description, country, city, start date, end date, expire date, and URL. The image cannot be updated.

**Note**: An event can only be edited within 30 days of the event start date.

get.x-amazon-apigateway-request-validator: Validate query string parameters and headers

event_id.description: The numeric ID of the event.

secret_code.description: A six-digit numeric key defined when the event was created and is used to authorize performing certain actions on an event. Note: It's also call "Edit Code"

claim_name.description: The name of the secret claim. This is the `claim_name` entered when creating a Website or Secret Word claim.

from.description: The date from which the secret is valid. Must be ISO format YYYY-MM-DDTHH-MM-SSZ.

to.description: The date to which the secret is valid. Must be ISO format YYYY-MM-DDTHH-MM-SSZ.

timezone.description: The timezone UTC offset for the secret date.

accepted_redeems.description: The number of POAPs that were accepted to be claimed using this secret.

put.description:
This endpoint is used to modify an existing secret word claim for a specific event.

To prevent someone from guessing your secret word, please use a generated randomized phrase (eg: increase-group-student), and keep your mint window open for less than 10 minutes.

Once the "word" or "website" is updated as you need, it's intended to be shared with your collectors to claim their POAP. Note: "word" is not compatible for claiming via API.

If using secret word, direct collectors to enter the secret word into POAP Mobile app.
If using "website", access via browser. If POAP Mobile app is on device when accessing "website", this will re-direct to POAP Mobile app and mint.
put.x-amazon-apigateway-request-validator: Validate query string parameters and headers

event_id.description: The numeric ID of the event.

requested_codes.description: The number of POAP codes that were requested for this secret.

secret_code.description: A six-digit numeric key defined when the event was created and is used to authorize performing certain actions on an event. Note: It's also call "Edit Code"

claim_name.description: The name of the secret claim. This is the `claim_name` entered when creating a Website or Secret Word claim.

from.description: The date from which the secret is valid. Must be ISO format YYYY-MM-DDTHH-MM-SSZ.

to.description: The date to which the secret is valid. Must be ISO format YYYY-MM-DDTHH-MM-SSZ.

timezone.description: The timezone UTC offset for the secret date.

post.description:
This endpoint is used to create a new secret word claim for a specific event. Secret word is a distribution method where POAPs can be claimed by using the specified secret word. This method only works on mobile when used with POAP Mobile app.

To prevent someone from guessing your secret word, please use a generated randomized phrase (eg: increase-group-student), and keep your mint window open for less than 10 minutes.

Once the "word" or "website" is created, it's intended to be shared with your collectors to claim their POAP. 

Note: "word" is not compatible for claiming via API.
If using secret word, direct collectors to enter the secret word into POAP Mobile app. 
If using "website", access via browser. If POAP Mobile app is on device when accessing "website", this will re-direct to POAP Mobile app and mint.
post.x-amazon-apigateway-request-validator: Validate query string parameters and headers

auth0-request.description:
Depending on your use case, you may or may not use a variety of our endpoints.
Some of these endpoints are protected.
If your use case requires you to have access to these endpoints, you need to use Auth Tokens to access them.
You can request Auth Tokens using the form here.
